ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 15 High Energy Proton and Alpha Detector (HEPAD) AP data at 32 s Resolution in Spacecraft Coordinates
ResourceHeader.Description: The GOES 15 High Energy Proton and Alpha Detector (HEPAD) provides flux measurements of high energy proton and alpha particles.  For more information, please see T. G. Onsager et al. (1996), Operational uses of the GOES energetic particle detectors, in GOES-8 and Beyond, Proc. SPIE, Vol. 2812, edited by E. R. Washwell, pp. 281-290, Bellingham, WA.  These data files contain mainly information on the alpha and proton particle counts and count rates for the HEPAD sensor. Data files contain long descriptive header.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA-Office of Space Science Applications (United States); NOAA National Environmental Satellite Service (United States); Dr. Terry G. Onsager

InformationURL.Name: GOES N, O, and P Brochure
InformationURL.Description: Information about the magnetometers onboard GOES 15.

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 15 High Energy Proton and Alpha Detector data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 15 High Energy Proton and Alpha Detector (HEPAD) data in CSV format as well as the energetic particle data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year, month, spacecraft, and file type. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, g15_hepad_ap_32s_20100531_20100531.csv, indicates goes 15 magnetometer data at 32 s resolution from start of May 31, 2010 to the end of May 31, 2010.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: NASA; NOAA; Dr. Terry G. Onsager

TimeSpan.Note: Data file may fill out the first month and last month with flags. Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Keyword: High Energy Proton and Alpha Detector

Parameter.Description: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.
